citeinfo.title: Depth resolved core physical-chemical data from Site 0 and AB transect, Barrow, Alaska

descript.abstract: This is a compilation of the physical and chemical data for cores collected at the NGEE-arctic site 0 and ABCD plots. The datasets are depth-resolved and down to ~ 4m below ground surface for some cores. The specific depths for each core where samples were analyzed vary from core to core. DOI:10.5440/1358456; http://dx.doi.org/10.5440/1358456
descript.purpose: Data were collected to understand the physical and geochemical characteristics of the arctic soil at the NGEE site

spdom.descgeog: Intensive site 0 and 1 (L2 and AB corridors), DTLB-1 and DTLB-2 corridors

method.methdesc: Cores were extracted in the winter and kept frozen until analysis. Computed Tomography (CT) data were used to select depths along the cores for sub-sample collection and analysis. Soil bulk density was measured with the water displacement method. After bulk density measurements, thawing of the samples was conducted anaerobically and pore water was extracted with mini-rhizon samplers. Subsequent analysis include major ions for the extracted pore water with IC and ICP-MS. The solid samplers were dried and subsequently ashed to measure the dry weight (i.e. dry bulk density) and Volatile compound (a proxy for soil carbon content).

ome.datause: These datasets provide baseline physical and geochemical characteristics of the NGEE Arctic soil covering both the active layer and shallow permafrost. They can be used to establish parameters for modeling the physical and biogeochemical processes.
